sn40.7:0.3: 7. A Question About the Dimension of Nothingness
sn40.7:1.1: “They speak of this thing called the ‘dimension of nothingness’.
sn40.7:1.2: What is the dimension of nothingness?
sn40.7:1.4: ‘It’s when a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that “there is nothing at all”, enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness.
sn40.7:1.5: This is called the dimension of nothingness.’
sn40.7:1.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the dimension of nothingness.
sn40.7:1.7: While I was in that meditation, perceptions and attentions accompanied by the dimension of infinite consciousness beset me.
sn40.7:2.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
sn40.7:2.3: Don’t neglect the dimension of nothingness, brahmin! Settle your mind in the dimension of nothingness; unify your mind and immerse it in the dimension of nothingness.’
sn40.7:2.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the dimension of nothingness.
sn40.7:2.5: So if anyone should be rightly called a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
